title: UPDATE: Bail set at $100K for woman accused in accidental shooting
content:
Autoplay:UPDATE: Woman arrested after accidental shooting of childCONNECTING...XUPDATE: Woman arrested after accidental shooting of child
LATEST: Bail has been set at $100K for Townsend. Her attorney argued for her to be released on her own recognizance. She was denied.
UPDATE: The investigation by the LVMPD Abuse and Neglect Section showed that a firearm was left unsecured within the home. Detectives determined that the suspect, identified as 30-year-old Shaletres Townsend, had placed her gun on a chair in a bedroom where children were playing. The gun accidentally discharged, striking the toddler.
Townsend was arrested and booked into the Clark County Detention Center on one count of Child Neglect with Substantial Bodily Harm.
A 4-year-old girl was accidentally shot at a residence in the 4200 block of Studio Street around 2:30 p.m. Sunday.
The child was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries. Her condition is stable.
Abuse and Neglect officers from the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department are investigating the shooting.
